Title: Senior Data Scientist
Descripcion: At PayPal (NASDAQ: PYPL), we believe that every person has the right to participate fully in the global economy. Our mission is to democratize financial services to ensure that everyone, regardless of background or economic standing, has access to affordable, convenient, and secure products and services to take control of their financial lives. Job Description Summary: What you need to know about the role: The Device Intelligence team at PayPal is responsible for detecting and preventing fraudulent activity in customer touchpoints such as sign-up, login, payments, and post-payment activities. They achieve this by collecting signals from browsers and mobile apps and converting them into actionable insights. The team is now expanding its focus to also defend against automated attacks and disrupt the economics of cybercrime. Meet our team: Data scientists are highly motivated team players with strong analytical skills who specialize in creating, driving and executing initiatives to mitigate fraud on PayPal‚Äôs platform and improve the experience for PayPal‚Äôs hundreds of millions of customers, while guaranteeing compliance with regulations. Our team in the Identity and Risk Lifecycle team are problem solvers suited to approach varied challenges in complex big data environments. As part of our day-to-day, we are collaborating with a wide variety of partners in the company, such as product experts, data scientists and engineers to bring our analytical insights to life, impacting the experience and security of millions of users around the globe. Job Description: Your way to impact:  Device Intelligence is a critical part of PayPal‚Äôs Risk Platform and in many ways considered the first line of defense against online fraudulent activity found in customer touchpoints such as sign-up, login, payments, and post-payment activities. In addition to its core capabilities of collecting signals from browsers and mobile apps and converting these signals into actionable insights to detect and prevent fraud, the Device Intelligence team is expanding its charter to be the first line of defense against automated attacks and in the process disrupt the economics of cybercrime. To achieve this vision of being the first line of defense against large-scale automated attacks, we are looking for an analytical and results-driven Data Scientist to join the Device Intelligence team in Guatemala. The Device Intelligence team is part of PayPal‚Äôs Identity and Risk Lifecycle Organization. Your day to day:  In your day to do you will: Build large-scale end-to-end data science solutions, to combat fraud, which balances risk, user experience, and financial performance.   Own the full lifecycle of a solution from the research phase to production. Provide regular updates to leadership, peers, and other stakeholders that simplify complex analytical research and insights into easy-to-follow actionable outcomes and drive impact for our customers, our stakeholders, and PayPal.  Collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders including product managers, engineers, and information security researchers to translate business challenges into Data Science problems  Look for improvement and innovation opportunities with business impact. Provide a source of high-quality ideas.‚ÄØ What do you need to bring: 5+ years of relevant work experience Bachelor‚Äôs Degree or above, or equivalent experience in a quantitative field (Engineering, Mathematics, Economics, Finance etc.) Demonstrated experience in data science and analytical problem solving Proven experience with Python, SQL Hadoop and big data experience - an advantage Strong English written and verbal skills a must, including the ability to explain and/or present analyses and convey complex ideas to all audiences **We know the confidence gap and imposter syndrome can get in the way of meeting spectacular candidates. Please don't hesitate to apply.  Please submit resume in English  Our Benefits: At PayPal, we‚Äôre committed to building an equitable and inclusive global economy. And we can‚Äôt do this without our most important asset‚Äîyou. That‚Äôs why we offer benefits to help you thrive in every stage of life. We champion your financial, physical, and mental health by offering valuable benefits and resources to help you care for the whole you. We have great benefits including a flexible work environment, employee shares options, health and life insurance and more. To learn more about our benefits please visit https://www.paypalbenefits.com Who We Are: To learn more about our culture and community visit https://about.pypl.com/who-we-are/default.aspx PayPal has remained at the forefront of the digital payment revolution for more than 20 years. By leveraging technology to make financial services and commerce more convenient, affordable, and secure, the PayPal platform is empowering more than 400 million consumers and merchants in more than 200 markets to join and thrive in the global economy. For more information, visit paypal.com. PayPal provides equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, PayPal will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. If you are unable to submit an application because of incompatible assistive technology or a disability, please contact us at paypalglobaltalentacquisition@paypal.com. As part of PayPal‚Äôs commitment to employees‚Äô health and safety, we have established in-office Covid-19 protocols and requirements, based on expert guidance. Depending on location, this might include a Covid-19 vaccination requirement for any employee whose role requires them to work onsite. Employees may request reasonable accommodation based on a medical condition or religious belief that prevents them from being vaccinated. REQ ID R0100622

Title: Growth Engineer to Pioneer LLM Driven Growth Strategies
Descripcion: We are seeking a Growth Engineer who is passionate about leveraging large language models (LLMs) to transform the world of growth marketing. In this role, you'll have the unique opportunity to drive our user acquisition and activation journey end-to-end, exploring and experimenting with innovative ways to use LLMs to promote Text Blaze‚Äôs capabilities and grow existing users' usage of Text Blaze by generating personalized content tailored to each user. About Text Blaze At Text Blaze, we're dedicated to freeing users from tedious work by providing them with simple yet powerful solutions. We're fast-paced, data-driven, and constantly iterating based on the needs of our users. Joining us means being part of a profitable, fast-growing company that already has an excellent product-market fit and a deeply loyal user base of over 300,000 users. As a member of our founding team, you'll have a substantial impact on our product, strategy, and culture. We're fully remote. You'll be part of a team that embraces ownership and impact, all while working comfortably from your own home. Skills And Qualifications A passion for talking to users and understanding their problems. A knack for identifying business needs and developing technical solutions to address them. An eye for design and comfort with designing your own UI's and solutions. Experience or strong interest working with large language models, prompt engineering and post-processing Proficiency in SQL, Python and JavaScript This is an opportunity to be at the forefront of the LLM-driven growth revolution. If you're eager to rethink growth and transform how we interact with potential users, we'd love to hear from you.

The firm develops and deploys investment strategies across a variety of asset classes in global markets . For more information on WorldQuant‚Äôs philosophy and culture, please visit  www.worldquant.com . Our Proposal: We have a new office in Montevideo, Uruguayüö© and are in the search of bold  DevOps Engineers   who want to  join us in this adventure. Communicate effectively during incident management. Contribute with empathy to the team‚Äôs code quality through code reviews and direct feedback. What you'll need in order to be successful in this job: A Computer Science degree or similar. 6+ years of combined software development and IT operations experience. Understanding Linux platform components: file systems, processes, memory, networking, etc. Demonstrated ability to operate distributed applications on Linux/Unix platforms. Must have working experience of highly scalable distributed and cloud native databases. Must be proficient at building applications with Python and have experience with its open source libraries and testing frameworks such as Pytest. Good working knowledge of SQL, Git, docker, and modern CI/CD pipelines. Knowledge of Streamsets or AWS Glue is a plus. Must have excellent verbal, non-verbal, and written communication skills, including ability to effectively communicate with internal and external customers. Comfortable working in a team setting and able to provide and receive constructive feedback. Experience with the healthcare industry is desirable Our Benefits & Perks A strong company culture whilst working on a 'remote-first‚Äô basis Engaging virtual meetings, company updates, and cultural celebrations Paid vacation & national holidays Performance bonus plan Holiday bonus Career development Wellness program Interested? Title: Full Stack Developer - Guatemala
Descripcion: This is a full-time opportunity for a Senior Full Stack Developer from Guatemala. IDT(www.idt.net) is an American telecommunications company founded in 1990 and headquartered in New Jersey. Today it is an industry leader in prepaid communication and payment services and one of the world‚Äôs largest international voice carriers. We are listed on the NYSE, employ over 1300 people across 20+ countries, and have revenues in excess of $1.5 billion. Our company, National Retail Solutions (NRS), currently a wholly owned subsidiary of IDT Corporation, is revolutionizing the independent retail industry by providing them with cost-effective, state of the art point of sale systems and complementary services such as apps for store management and consumer ordering, web store front for the store, and loyalty programs allowing small retailers to more effectively compete with the larger store chains and online merchants. We are deployed in well over 18 thousand stores across the US at this time. Our development team is in search of a candidate to contribute and lead a small team to enhance and add to our suite of products, services and features with a can-do attitude, who thrives in a fast-paced work environment and is highly motivated to deliver software to production. This position is initially remote but occasional visits to the office in the future. What you will be doing: Leading a small team of developers Working closely with product managers on feature design Proposing and working with others on solution architectures Assigning tech requirements to team members Monitoring and owning deliverables Hands on development (50% or more) Code reviews Working on projects such as enhancing existing, and creating new, frontend and backend subsystems for our internal and customer-facing portals, apps and Linux-based point of sale system, ranging from eCommerce, EDI and a CRM for store owners Required skills: Minimum 4-6 years of professional experience in a full-stack development role Minimum 2 years experience leading a development team Experience prioritizing roadmap projects while supporting previously deployed projects Professional experience with vue.js, calling and implementing APIs, HTML 3 Professional experience with PHP or node.js for backend development Professional experience with SQL databases (preference PostgreSQL) Experience with distributed source code control  Excellent English verbal and written communication skills including documenting data flow Ability to interact professionally with a diverse group: clients, executives, managers, and coworkers  Nice to have skills: Experience with github, Jira, node.js, Lubuntu Experience with PostgreSQL Experience with angular.js Experience with both PHP & node.js Working knowledge of Linux system administration Working knowledge of AWS services Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field Please attach CV in English. The interview process will be conducted in English. Only accepting applicants from Guatemala.

Descripcion: We believe that for Equality, Diversity, and Inclusion to thrive in the workplace all individuals must feel Safe, Valued, and Respected. And that the only way to accomplish this is if the business model places these priorities first. Which is exactly what we do each day. We are a Female, LGBTQ, and Minority led virtual-first startup that welcomes technologists from all lifestyles, theologies, cultures, disabilities, and backgrounds. And seeks to empower people with the freedom to own their remote career path in a safe merit driven transparent culture where everyone is treated equally. So if you are looking for a new career partner that is remote-first, has a social mission, and only works with companies that share our values‚Ä¶ then let‚Äôs talk about our Data Analyst today. Here is what we can tell you about the role. THE WORK Gather, analyze, and interpret large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights that can drive business growth and optimize operations. Develop and implement data models, algorithms, and statistical techniques to extract meaningful information from structured and unstructured data sources. Design and maintain data dashboards, reports, and visualizations using various Business Intelligence (BI) tools to communicate data insights effectively. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define and prioritize data requirements, ensuring the accuracy, completeness, and reliability of data sources. Identify data quality issues, perform data cleansing, and implement data validation processes to ensure data integrity. Stay up-to-date with industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in data analysis, and proactively propose innovative solutions to enhance data-driven decision-making. Provide data-driven recommendations and insights to support business strategies and optimize key performance indicators (KPIs). Conduct ad-hoc analysis and generate reports as requested by stakeholders, such as senior management, marketing teams, or operations teams. Collaborate with data engineers and IT teams to optimize data infrastructure, improve data accessibility, and streamline data workflows. NEEDED EXPERTISE Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field such as Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related discipline. Advanced degree preferred. Minimum of 2 years of professional experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar role. Strong proficiency in SQL for data extraction, manipulation, and analysis from relational databases. Demonstrated experience with at least one major Business Intelligence (BI) tool, such as Tableau, Power BI, or QlikView, for data visualization and reporting. Proficiency in at least one programming language for data analysis and manipulation, such as Python or R. Knowledge of both languages is a plus. Solid understanding of statistical concepts and experience applying statistical techniques to analyze and interpret data. Familiarity with data modeling, data warehousing, and ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes. Experience with data cleansing, data validation, and data quality assurance. Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work with complex and large datasets. Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to translate complex data insights into actionable recommendations. Strong attention to detail and the ability to deliver high-quality work within deadlines. Proven ability to work independently as well as in cross-functional teams. Our Benefits & Perks A strong company culture whilst working on a 'remote-first‚Äô basis Engaging virtual meetings, company updates, and cultural celebrations Paid vacation & national holidays Performance bonus plan Holiday bonus Career development Wellness program Interested? Great, then please send us your CV/Resume to start the conversation and find out more. EQUALS TRUE is a global inclusive talent network of like-minded software engineers, agileist, and design thinkers. We build and develop safe, inclusive, equitable and balanced remote teams for companies that need to scale globally in a socially responsible way. EQUALS TRUE is inclusive to all and all of our career opportunities are fully-remote. We never exclude qualified people, we practice wage equality, we make every effort to accommodate disabilities, and only work with companies that share our values. We are proud to be a global equal opportunity affirmative action employer. And we do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, gender stereotypes, age, status as a veteran, or status as an individual with a disability. We also consider qualified applicants with non-violent, and non-financial related criminal histories. EQUALS TRUE is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in all our talent processes. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know. https://equalstrue.global #EQUALSTRUE

Title: Front-End Developer - Adobe Commerce
Descripcion: For over 20 years, Gorilla has been devising, creating, and implementing commerce experiences. We‚Äôre a client-driven culture, looking for resourceful, motivated, and talented individuals to help us exceed our client‚Äôs expectations at every turn. We offer a challenging and rewarding environment where you‚Äôll have the opportunity to work with leading brands, collaborate with some of the brightest people in the industry, and share in our mutual success. Gorilla Group will be rebranding as Wunderman Thompson Commerce & Technology, effective during the second quarter. This will also bring together specialized capabilities across North America to strengthen the Wunderman Thompson commerce and technology offering. What We Are Looking For We‚Äôre seeking skilled front-end developers to join our Engineering team. You will work side by side with our design developers (Creative Technologists) and back-end developers to build custom Adobe Commerce (Magento) websites. The ideal candidate will need to possess a strong understanding of the principles of web development technologies as pertains to the front-end, including HTML, CSS & pre-processors, Javascript, as well as today‚Äôs modern Javascript Frameworks. What You'll Be Doing Building custom front-end themes for our commerce clientele within the Adobe Commerce platform. Working within our team of Senior Adobe Commerce FEDs to grow your depth of knowledge with front-end development on the Adobe Commerce platform. Adhere to best practices provided in the static markup from the Creative Technologists for UI performance, accessibility, and SEO optimizations. Identify and implement appropriate solutions for performance improvements from Google PageSpeed Insights. Implement custom data layer objects through JavaScript for analytics or tag management platforms like Adobe or Google Analytics. What You Should Bring To The Table Strong understanding of web markups such as HTML5 and CSS3. Proficient in creating responsive web applications compatible with desktops, tablets, mobile, etc. Understanding at least one server-side CSS pre-processor, such as SASS or LESS. Experience utilizing Version Control Software such as GIT. Good understanding of client-side scripting and JavaScript frameworks. Strong interpersonal and communication skills with an affinity for problem-solving and collaboration. Possess strong time management skills during projects by organizing daily workload based on prioritization of tasks. English language fluency in both written and verbal communication Preferred/Assets Experience developing custom themes and functionality within Adobe Commerce  Experience with front-end build tools such as Gulp, Grunt, etc. Experience with React/PWA applications. Gorilla is committed to  Equal Employment Opportunity  and to attracting and retaining the most qualified employees regardless of race, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender, age or disability.

Title: Digital Solutions | Jr. DevOps Engineer
Descripcion: As a DevOps of our Video and Digital Home team, you will be at the helm of supporting a plethora of home and TV/media platforms and features using Agile development processes. This team is a part of our Future Friendly Home Services DevOps team, which is responsible for the end-to-end technology development and operations of TELUS‚Äô Optik TV services, video and over-the-top services, broadband network capabilities, smart home solutions, and software-defined wide area network (SD-WAN) solutions. Be a part of a transformational journey with innovative and leading-edge technologies. Here‚Äôs the impact you‚Äôll make and what we‚Äôll accomplish together You will help define the architecture for our new Future Friendly Home initiatives, integrating newly developed software with components from leading vendors into a complex cloud-first pattern, in order to deliver to our customers the best possible experience. Here's how : You will support a video platform/microservices deployed on OCP and GKE clusters and using Galera DB, Cassandra, and Elastic Search You will troubleshoot the Platform microservices using Splunk, Dynatrace, or other monitoring tools You will work cross-functionally to define SLIs, SLOs, and SLAs and set up the proper monitoring and alerting to minimize downtime You will deploy new microservices into the platform to offer new features to our customers Operational processes and procedures are part of your DNA Work with cloud-native technologies, combining modern technologies, practices, and products into a cohesive platform to enable world-leading software development. You will provide an indication of the effort needed to implement the necessary solutions based on your proactive operational observations. You will manage on-call schedules and escalation processes You're the missing piece of the puzzle with these skills: Kubernetes Container platforms (GKE, EKS, OpenShift) Infrastructure-as-Code (Terraform) Galera, Cassandra, Elastic Search, MySQL Load Balancers, Firewalls, Networking Linux ActiveMQ Continuous Integration/Delivery (GitHub Actions, GCP Cloud Build, Spinnaker, Jenkins)  Required Skills & Abilities:  You have 3+ experience as SRE / DevOps Support You have worked in environments where you were responsible for understanding and ensuring the reliable operation of deployments from end-to-end (front-end to the database as well as data ingestion pipelines) Worked with monitoring tools and understand best practices for alerting A strong understanding and previous experience with cloud infrastructure such as GCP or other clouds etc Understanding of SSH, VPN, TCP/IP, DNS, HTTP(S), network routing and subnets Experience with Configuration Management and Infrastructure as Code - Terraform, Ansible Good Splunk, Dynatrace or similar tools used to monitor and troubleshoot. You have good operational knowledge on Kubernetes, MySQL (Galera or MariaDB clusters), Elastic Search and Cassandra High degree of curiosity and ownership  Equal Opportunity Employer:  At TELUS International, we are proud to be an equal-opportunity employer and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace. All aspects of employment, including the decision to hire and promote, are based on applicants‚Äô qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity Additional Job Description As a DevOps of our Video and Digital Home team, you will be at the helm of supporting a plethora of home and TV/media platforms and features using Agile development processes. This team is a part of our Future Friendly Home Services DevOps team, which is responsible for the end-to-end technology development and operations of TELUS‚Äô Optik TV services, video and over-the-top services, broadband network capabilities, smart home solutions, and software-defined wide area network (SD-WAN) solutions. Be a part of a transformational journey with innovative and leading-edge technologies. EEO Statement At TELUS International, we enable customer experience innovation through spirited teamwork, agile thinking, and a caring culture that puts customers first. TELUS International is the global arm of TELUS Corporation, one of the largest telecommunications service providers in Canada. We deliver contact center and business process outsourcing (BPO) solutions to some of the world's largest corporations in the consumer electronics, finance, telecommunications and utilities sectors. With global call center delivery capabilities, our multi-shore, multi-language programs offer safe, secure infrastructure, value-based pricing, skills-based resources and exceptional customer service - all backed by TELUS, our multi-billion dollar telecommunications parent. Equal Opportunity Employer At TELUS International, we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace. All aspects of employment, including the decision to hire and promote, are based on applicants‚Äô qualifications, merits, competence and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

What's on Offer? Work with an inspiring and growing company Directly contribute to commercial products to help people Excellent career development opportunities

Title: DevOps AWS/Kubernetes Engineer - Remote - Latin America
Descripcion: FullStack is the fastest-growing software consultancy in the Americas. We help organizations like Uber, GoDaddy, MGM, Siemens, Stanford University, and the State of California, build distributed software development teams, and deliver transformational digital solutions. As an employee-first company, we focus on hiring the most talented software designers and developers in the western hemisphere, by creating a positive, respectful, and supportive work environment where they can achieve their greatest potential. We‚Äôre most proud of: Offering life-changing career opportunities to talented software professionals across the Americas. Building highly-skilled software development teams for hundreds of the world‚Äôs greatest companies. Having delivered hundreds of successful custom software solutions, which have positively impacted the lives and careers of millions of users. Our 4.5-star rating on GlassDoor. Our client Net Promoter Score of 68, twice the industry average. The Position: We're looking to hire DevOps AWS/Kubernetes Engineer to join our team. You'll work with our incredible clients in one of two ways: Team Augmentation: You will integrate yourself directly into our client's team and work alongside their existing designers and engineers on a daily basis. Design & Build: You will work on a FullStack product team to build and deliver a product to our clients What We're Looking For: 4+ years of professional software development experience. Meaningful experience as a DevOps engineer. Meaningful experience working with AWS services and technologies. Experience with Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment (CI/CD) pipelines and related tools. Proficiency in Kubernetes, including cluster management, deployment, and monitoring. Advanced English is required.  Advanced analytics. Storage design for high availability and disaster recovery. Knowledge of statistics/machine learning. Ability to take extreme ownership over your work. Every day is a challenge to ensure you are performing to the expectations you and your team have agreed upon. Must be a self-starter that requires only limited supervision/guidance. Benefits: Competitive Salary Paid Time Off (vacation, sick leave, maternity and paternity leave, holidays) 100% remote work The ability to work with leading startups and Fortune 500 companies English Classes Virtual company events each month Ample opportunity for career advancement Continuing education opportunities FullStack is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form, which can be provided upon request during our hiring and interview process. Learn more about our Applicants Privacy Notice .

Title: Mobile Engineer
Descripcion: Our mission is to unlock the collaborative power of communities by making Web3 universally easy to use, access, and build on Working with ConsenSys puts you at the  forefront of an evolving paradigm , transforming our society for the better. We fundamentally believe blockchain is the next generation of technology that can lay the foundation for a more just and equitable society. Blockchain tech is just over 10 years old. Ethereum itself is still a toddler and we‚Äôre far from reaching our full potential. You‚Äôll get to work on the tools, infrastructure, and apps that scale these platforms to billions of users. You‚Äôll be constantly exposed to new concepts, ideas, and frameworks from your peers, and as you work on different projects ‚Äî challenging you to stay at the  top of your game . You‚Äôll join a network of entrepreneurs and technologists that reaches the  edge of our ecosystem . ConsenSys alumni have moved on to become tech entrepreneurs, CEOs, and team leads at tech companies. About MetaMask We‚Äôre building for a future where the internet and world economy empowers people through interactions based on consent, privacy, and free association. Where both communities and individuals flourish. To accomplish that, we‚Äôre working hard to make web3 accessible for everyone. MetaMask is both a crypto wallet and a gateway to the decentralized web. Our tools help people create communities, play video games, access financial services, make payments, invest in assets, protect against economic turmoil, and more. Our browser extension and mobile platforms meet the needs of millions of users and developers across the world. Originally a humble key manager, today MetaMask serves over 30 million monthly active users as a decentralized application development platform, an aggregator of decentralized cryptocurrency exchanges, and a decentralized identity manager. Working with ConsenSys puts you at the forefront of an  evolving paradigm , transforming our society for the better. We fundamentally believe blockchain is the next generation of technology that can lay the foundation for a more just and equitable society. Blockchain tech is just over 10 years old. Ethereum itself is still a toddler and we‚Äôre far from reaching our full potential. You‚Äôll get to work on the tools, infrastructure, and apps that scale these platforms to billions of users. You‚Äôll be constantly exposed to new concepts, ideas, and frameworks from your peers, and as you work on different projects ‚Äî challenging you to stay at the top of your game. You‚Äôll join a network of entrepreneurs and technologists that reaches the edge of our ecosystem. ConsenSys alumni have moved on to become tech entrepreneurs, CEOs, and team leads at tech companies. About MetaMask We‚Äôre building for a future where the internet and world economy empowers people through interactions based on consent, privacy, and free association. Where both communities and individuals flourish. To accomplish that, we‚Äôre working hard to make web3 accessible for everyone. MetaMask is both a crypto wallet and a gateway to the decentralized web. Our tools help people create communities, play video games, access financial services, make payments, invest in assets, protect against economic turmoil, and more. Our browser extension and mobile platforms meet the needs of millions of users and developers across the world. Originally a humble key manager, today MetaMask serves over 30 million monthly active users as a decentralized application development platform, an aggregator of decentralized cryptocurrency exchanges, and a decentralized identity manager. What You‚Äôll Do The MetaMask mobile wallet is growing and looking for mobile engineers to support and build exciting features enabling access to all through the mobile platform. We‚Äôre hiring mobile engineers to join our mobile app teams. We are looking for someone with a deep experience with both javascript and building mobile products. This person will be focused on helping lead feature development in our React Native codebase. In this role, you‚Äôll be working on web3 technologies, working to keep people‚Äôs funds safe and secure, and collaborating with design and QA to create the best product possible. Would be great if you brought this to the role Multiple years of experience shipping javascript code to production Demonstrable proficiency with React Native Comfort with, and an eagerness for, building mobile products and working within a mobile development environment Multiple years of experience in roles requiring collaboration design, QA and product An interest in blockchain and an eagerness to learn A passion for our mission and values Proactive and self-driven to be successful working in a remote environment Brings enthusiasm and the hustle to shipping high-quality code Are kind, empathetic, and supportive towards the team Timezone: EST / PST ideally, if in EU/UK you are able to have ~4 hours overlap with the American time zones Don't meet all the requirements? Don't sweat it. We‚Äôre passionate about building a diverse team of humans and as such, if you think you've got what it takes for our chaotic-but-fun, remote-friendly, start-up environment‚Äîapply anyway, detailing your relevant transferable skills in your cover letter. While we have a pretty good idea of what we need, we're ready for you to challenge our thinking on who needs to be in this role. ConsenSys is an equal opportunity employer. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply. We are committed to ensuring that our technology is made available and accessible to everyone. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. ConsenSys is aware of fraudulent recruitment practices and we encourage all applicants to review our best practices to protect yourself which can be found (https://consensys.net/careers/best-practices-to-avoid-recruitment-fraud/) . The salary range for US-based candidates only will be determined throughout the interview process depending on experience and skills. Candidates should anticipate a base salary (not including bonus, equity or other benefits) of $USD123,000 - $USD255,000

Title: Data Engineer
Descripcion: AlphaPoint is a financial technology company powering digital asset exchanges and brokerages worldwide. Through its secure, scalable, and customizable white label digital asset trading platform, AlphaPoint has enabled over 150 customers in 35 countries to launch and operate digital asset markets, as well as digitize assets. AlphaPoint and its award winning blockchain technology have helped startups and institutions discover and execute their blockchain strategies since 2013. Remote Position Latam Countries Prefer Job Description: We are seeking a high potential Data Analyst to join our team. This position will help us to enable the advanced analytical tools and reports, create insights on metrics and KPIs to make data-driven decisions and improve our services. Extract and analyze the data in different data sources. Build reports and dashboards. Use data to share insights on areas of improvement. Research market and industry to provide suggestions on analytical tools and related benchmarks. Establish and populate Metrics and KPIs. Provide quantitative metrics in solutions. Responsibilities: Create analytical solutions. Connect to data sources. Extract and process information. Provide insights based on data and relevant information. Basic requirements: Have strong skills of designing, creating, releasing and supporting infrastructure solutions with Linux and Windows based server environments, databases, services and APIs. Work across multiple environments with scripts, programming languages, DevOps tools and restful web APIs. Take the role of Subject Matter Expert in technical project deliverables and be responsible for data analysis of metrics regarding a solution implementation. Collaborate with other infrastructure, engineering, application and support teams. Maintain the requirements to develop the cycle at a consistent pace. Writing documentation and standard operating procedure when required. Create reports, dashboards and alerts to detect anomalies. Support in the first level of identifying root causes for issues. Maintain oversight in a complex system with an extensive set of KPIs and identify anomalies with business impact. Extend the monitoring system and generate ad-hoc reports to improve oversight. Communicate with stakeholders and external dependencies/service providers. Preferred skills & knowledge: Experience in setting up and optimizing the data analysis tools such as Tableau and Grafana is a must. Experience of monitoring logs and metrics with tools such as InfluxDB, Prometheus, Fluentd, Elasticsearch and Splunk would be an advantage. Software development experience with programming languages like C#, Java or Python is required. Knowledge of Databases such as MySQL, MS-SQL, Oracle or MongoDB would be an advantage. Familiarity with IT Infrastructure delivery and related processes would be an advantage. Experience of 2 - 3 years with Kibana, Grafana, or similar applications. Working experience as Data Engineer, Developer with passion for gaining data insights or similar roles as well as in querying on SQL or other similar languages. Proficiency in server admin skills Linux and MS Windows. Industry standard certifications for the Linux domain is a plus. Experience of RESTful APIs and scripting for data management, feeds and exception handling tasks. Experience of source code management (GitHub / Bit Bucket) is essential. A natural sense of curiosity, Passion for data analysis and visualization of information. Self-driven, self-managed & strong sense of ownership. Capable of multi-tasking & able to prioritize their own time according to business requirements Capable of quickly understanding complex concepts and systems. Structured & analytically minded. Understanding the challenges in transactional IT payment processes. Fluent spoken and written English skills. Other Soft Skills: Excellent written and spoken technical and non-technical communication skills. Understanding of DevOps process and Agile development cycle with Continuous Integration / Delivery (CI/CD). Have good experience creating design documents (HLD, LLD) diagrams (Visio) and presentations (PPT). Good analytical mindset for problem solving under stress and time pressure. Working across various cultures and geographies. Should be willing to work in shifts / on call in case required. Able to work independently, under least supervision. Here are some of the benefits of working at AlphaPoint: Competitive salary Unlimited Vacation Brex company credit card Computer equipment and workplace furniture to suit your needs Great colleagues and an inspiring startup environment with colleagues internationally

Title: Senior Software Engineer, Trilogy (Remote) - $100,000/year USD
Descripcion: Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, Trilogy. Have you got what it takes? Are you a software engineer that thrives on complex challenges and is eager to make a real impact? Join our team where you'll be contributing to our strategic product line, that‚Äôs looking to reshape industries and change the way people work and learn. Our strategic product line includes: Crossover: An AI-powered hiring platform that sifts through millions of applicants per year to find the top 1% of global remote talent. We're breaking down geographical barriers and making high-paying jobs accessible to professionals worldwide, regardless of their location. gt.school: An online education platform that uses advanced data collection, algorithms, and AI-generated content to empower students to learn at their own pace. Our adaptive learning system fills knowledge gaps, accelerates learning, and helps students master a whole grade level on a subject within weeks. Data-driven Sales: This initiative leverages data and AI algorithms to streamline the sales process across a portfolio of over 100 software products. We're transitioning these products to a unified platform based on Salesforce and NetSuite, all while handling complex data imports, synchronization, modeling divergences and data inconsistencies. What we offer: The opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies, including the latest in AWS serverless and no-code/low-code patterns. The opportunity to learn and experiment with using generative AI to boost your productivity. A team of exceptionally talented engineers from around the world as your peers. The chance to work on products that are reshaping industries and making a difference in people's lives. We're not just using AI as a buzzword. We're at the start of a thrilling journey with generative AI, experimenting and learning to fully leverage its potential and free our engineers from mundane tasks, allowing them to focus on what truly matters: design, decision-making, and understanding the far-reaching implications of different implementation strategies. In this role, your expertise and decision-making skills will be valued and utilized to their full potential. If you're ready to take your career to the next level and be part of a team that's changing the way we work and learn, we'd love to hear from you. What You Will Be Doing Developing cloud-native backends and implementing data processing algorithms using the latest serverless cloud patterns, including AWS. Review code to ensure adherence to best practices, team standards, and customer requirements. What You Won‚Äôt Be Doing Spending time on minor bug fixes or features in outdated codebases. Dealing with tedious infrastructure to keep poorly written products running. Getting stuck in endless meetings discussing roadmaps and priorities or chasing people around. Basic Requirements Senior Software Engineer key responsibilities A university degree (BS, MS, or PhD) that included an in-depth study of data structures, algorithms, object-oriented programming, computer architecture, and software engineering OR relevant work experience. At least 4 years of experience writing production code for the server side of web applications. At least 2 years of experience being the primary technical contributor for a development team OR software product. At least 1 year of hands-on experience developing using cloud patterns (any cloud vendor). Nice-to-have Requirements A personal interest and some experience in using generative A.I. in your day-to-day development About Trilogy Hundreds of software businesses run on the Trilogy Business Platform. For three decades, Trilogy has been known for 3 things: Relentlessly seeking top talent, Innovating new technology, and incubating new businesses. Our technological innovation is spearheaded by a passion for simple customer-facing designs. Our incubation of new businesses ranges from entirely new moon-shot ideas to rearchitecting existing projects for today's modern cloud-based stack. Trilogy is a place where you can be surrounded with great people, be proud of doing great work, and grow your career by leaps and bounds. There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you! Working with Crossover This is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $50 USD/hour, which equates to $100,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic. What to expect next: You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application. Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online ‚Äúscreening‚Äù assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments. Important!  If you do not receive an email from us: First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again. Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as ‚ÄúNot Spam‚Äù since you will receive other emails as well. Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked. If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.  Crossover Job Code: LJ-4358-GT-Guatemal-SeniorSoftware.025

As an employee-first company, we focus on hiring the most talented software designers and developers in the western hemisphere, by creating a positive, respectful, and supportive work environment where they can achieve their greatest potential. Title: Sr.Developer, Salesforce, LATAM
Descripcion: Position Title & Location :  Senior Developer, Salesforce, LATAM   Purpose Responsible for the delivery and support of the portfolio of IT solutions and services to meet the Brambles global functional CRM needs. Specifically, this role requires combining his/her technical background and experience in the delivery of Salesforce desktop and mobile solutions and enhancements.   Major /Key Accountabilities Lead technical analysis and documentation of technical & functional requirements & enhancements including solution design, integration design and functional design. Provide demos, mock-ups, and proof of concepts to business stakeholders demonstrating functional and technical capabilities of CRM applications. Document and deliver business requirements and enhancements in an agile iterative approach while adhering to governance and quality standards. Configure the application and work with technical resources to support object development and unit testing, user acceptance testing, integration and regression testing, and change management activities. Provide support for internal and external customers including troubleshooting, identifying system and process improvements, and introducing new technology as appropriate. Analyse and diagnose data quality or system deficiency issues while providing options for resolution. Support system extracts, enhancements, and other ongoing support tasks as appropriate. Negotiate, commit to, and control project schedules for his/her own deliverables.   Qualifications BS in Information Systems, Computer Science, MIS, Engineering, Mathematics, Business, and/or relevant work experience (foreign degree equivalent accepted).   Experience 8+ years of IT experience with minimum 5+ years delivering core Salesforce development solutions and customizations   Skills & Knowledge ¬∑ Implement Salesforce functionalities including custom platform development (Apex, Visualforce, Lightning Components & Development) ¬∑ Deploy code and configuration changes across various SF environments using Jenkins. ¬∑ Ability to resolve code conflicts and fix deployment errors. ¬∑ Perform test class run and deployment automation in Jenkins. ¬∑ Perform peer code reviews ¬∑ Experience with Einstein Analytics (Wave Analytics). ¬∑ Knowledge of best coding and design practices. Self- sufficient and independent in resolving end to end support tickets. ¬∑ Write test methods as a feature of your codebase ¬∑ Work with other team members across multiple projects and articulate development or deployment in functional manner. ¬∑ Actively engages improving software delivery through DevOps and other Agile practices ¬∑ Prior implementation of Salesforce solutions to support business processes. ¬∑ Salesforce application development experience including APEX, Visual Force, Lightning Components ¬∑ Developing advanced user interfaces on the Salesforce platform using technologies (HTML/CSS/Lightning frameworks) ¬∑ Experience with Agile/Scrum and Test-driven development methodologies ¬∑ Experience working with Apex REST services and API integrations ¬∑ Experience with Jenkin and Bitbucket including merging, reverting source control branches. ¬∑ Experience with common API and integration patterns ¬∑ Experience or familiarity with Lightning Component development ¬∑ Salesforce1/Force.com knowledge ¬∑ Desired Experience: Visual Studio Code, Version and source control tools, Force.com IDE, Shell script automation)   Languages Advanced English/Spanish

Title: Mid/Senior Backend Software Engineer- Guatemala
Descripcion: Spiff (https://spiff.com), recently named one of the most innovative Fintech companies, is on a mission to inspire, enable, and reward peak business performance. Why? Commission plans are used by modern companies to reward and drive good behavior using more advanced rules or combinations of rules such as quota attainment, accelerators, and other types of variable earnings. Great Commission plans motivate Salespeople to sell more to the right companies. In order to help companies and reps to reach their full potential, we take the manual labor and complexity of current commission processes and completely automate them. Finance teams used to spend hours each month trying to prepare commissions, communicate them to their reps, deal with discrepancies, and then get those paid on time. Spiff automates that full process. We connect to the client's systems; CRM, ERP & Payroll to reduce the work and amount of errors. Spiff gives powerful, real-time data and insights to reps, managers, and executives about their commissions. We‚Äôre looking for a passionate  Back End Software Engineer  to join our growing team and help us deliver intuitive and delightful experiences to our customers. As a Back End Software Engineer, you will build tools that bridge the gap from spreadsheets to automated systems so that sales teams can have fast feedback and accurate information. The backend teams at Spiff ensure a low-latency experience for our users by building resilient and efficient code on the server-side of web interactions. Syncing data from customer systems, versioned changes to commission plans, and progressive disclosure of statement details are some of the things we work on. What You‚Äôll Contribute In This Role‚Ä¶ Design and develop new feature for the Spiff application in Ruby on Rails Maintain and optimize existing code Collaborate with product and design teams to understand user needs and deliver high-quality solutions Lead code reviews and mentor junior engineers Stay up-to-date with the latest technologies and industry trends What Experience You‚Äôll Bring To Spiff‚Ä¶ +5 years of professional experience as a Software Developer  Strong experience with Ruby on Rails Experience with React & Redux Experience with PostgreSQL Experience with Git Strong problem-solving and debugging skills Strong written and verbal communication skills Strong team player Bonus Points  Interest in Startups/Tech/Finance. Our team loves the startup community, and a genuine interest in the space is huge.  Background in enterprise software development or deployment  You‚Äôve worked at a rapidly growing startup, especially early stage What Types Of Perks And Benefits We Offer‚Ä¶ Competitive Salary Health Benefits Remote First & Friendly Company At Spiff, we're committed to building a diverse and inclusive organization that reflects the ever-changing world around us. We strive for an equitable workplace where everyone feels welcome regardless of gender identity or sexual orientation; race or ethnicity; age; physical ability; socio-economic status; religious beliefs; political views or affiliations; or any other factor that can be used to make someone feel excluded from the workplace experience. Our unwavering commitment to this mission is founded on the idea that varied perspectives drive innovation. We know that fostering a diverse and inclusive team has a positive impact on our products and services, and helps us better serve our customers, employees, and community stakeholders. That's why we're building a culture where differences are celebrated and an environment where people from all backgrounds are treated with respect and given the freedom to be their authentic selves.

Title: CICD Site Reliability Engineer
Descripcion: Recognized as one of Canada‚Äôs fastest-growing companies, Launchpad provides next-generation integration platform capabilities for connecting and managing enterprise automation and data integration. Headquartered in Vancouver, Canada, our operations span both North and South Americas, with a second headquarter located in Santiago, Chile. In 2021, we were recognized as the winner of the BC Tech Associations Technology Impact Awards 'Company of The Year: Growth'. We recognize the global truth that today, every company is a tech company. To succeed, every company everywhere needs their data and workflows to be integrated and automated. That understanding gave us the confidence to compete with our sector's leading providers, win top-level contracts, and build a truly world-class list of clients that includes Walmart, GM, TIME Magazine, Salesforce, Tableau, Splunk, Bolt.com, Freedom House, and more. Our vision is to bring people and technology together to work seamlessly to achieve extraordinary business outcomes and create more efficient societies. If this sounds like something you want to be part of, we‚Äôd love to hear from you. Responsibilities: Configure, deploy and maintain Cloud Infrastructure using Infrastructure as Code (IaC) such as CloudFormation or Terraform Collaborate with your peers as a subject matter expert on Cloud, Release Management, Datacenter Technologies, Automation, Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS), IaC, SysOps, and DevOps Development of Release Management strategies for various architectures; Zero Downtime Deployments, Blue-Green, Canary Releases, etc.  Configuration and Management of Linux Servers to run custom-built applications using Configuration Management (CM) tooling such as Ansible or Chef Working knowledge of Networking, and ability to implement secure cloud and hybrid networks.  Cognizance of security best practices Implementation of monitoring for cloud and custom applications Automation of deployment and release cycles using all of the above integrated into a Continuous Integration and Delivery tool such as GitLab CI, etc Configure and implement a variety of deployment mechanisms (blue/green, rolling updates, etc) automatically and route traffic accordingly.  Configure application deployments to automatically send all application logs, container logs, host logs, AWS resource logs.  Deploy applications in a highly available configuration such that critical applications will not fail, alerts will be triggered, and backup and failover systems will automatically come online when critical systems start failing.  Work closely with Architects, Developers, Security, and Clients to implement Cloud architecture that spans Serverless, Container, Server, component-based, and Hybrid utilizing industry best practices.  Skills: BS degrees in Computer Science or related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.  3+ years of experience as a Site Reliability Engineer, Production Engineer or Backend Software Engineer for web-scale or similar platforms.  Experience with security tooling and best practices for implementation in development pipelines and infrastructure.  Experience with security event management, vulnerability management, intrusion detection and threat management systems Experience with integrating applications Experience with the development and support of major cloud infrastructure and platform services (AWS).  Experience with configuring continuous integration software and code pipelines (Gitlab, Jenkins).  Experience with container and container management, and security scanning technologies (EKS, ECS).  Experience collaborating with customer security teams, auditors, and external security consultants.  Experience with configuration management systems for cloud infrastructure and operating systems (Terraform, Ansible).  Demonstrated coding experience with an interpreted programming or scripting language (Python, Bash, PowerShell, JavaScript).  Experience with the Git source control system and ability to assist others in troubleshooting issues.  Experience in working with industry-leading IAM vendor products like SailPoint, Azure AD, Okta etc.  Understanding of Agile software development and management tools (Jira).  Deep hands-on understanding of High Availability, Scalability, Secure Cloud, Disaster Recovery, Release Management as implemented among various architectures eg: Serverless, Container, Server Excellent written and verbal communication skills Experience with Identity and Access Management solutions is nice-to-have Why work for Launchpad? 100% remote People first culture Excellent compensation in US Dollars Hardware setup for working from home Work with global teams and prominent brands based in North America, Europe, and Asia Training allowances Personal time off (PTO) for vacations, study leave, personal time, etc.  ...and more! At Launchpad, we genuinely care about our people as individuals. If you are looking for a team that values growth, drive, and passion for your craft, if you‚Äôre seeking a place to achieve your goals and dreams with fairness and integrity, then you are the future of Launchpad. Launchpad is committed to fostering a diverse and representative workforce and an inclusive work environment where all employees are respected and treated equally. Are you ready to elevate your career at Launchpad? We want to hear your story! Contact us today.

Title: Senior Software Engineer - Backend
Descripcion: At PayPal (NASDAQ: PYPL), we believe that every person has the right to participate fully in the global economy. Our mission is to democratize financial services to ensure that everyone, regardless of background or economic standing, has access to affordable, convenient, and secure products and services to take control of their financial lives. Job Description Summary: Looking for a backend Staff Software Engineer who will helping and leading the efforts to build, improve and maintain PayPal's Remittances Platform. Our team is focused on building, improving, and supporting the core API‚Äôs that power the backend services for Xoom a PayPal service. Job Description: Your way to Impact: The impact you will bring goes directly to PayPal profitability through the remittance product, providing the core API's and services required to enable our customers to do cross border remittance transactions through PayPal. Additionally, this platform also powers the mobile and website products for Xoom, a PayPal service, meaning that you will be serving not only PayPal customers, but also Xoom customers. You will lead in the design and development of Java based API‚Äôs and backend services, working in a high-performance teamwork environment. Help and drive to identify, design, and build automated test frameworks to enable validation of the solution for scalability, consistency, accuracy, and repeatability. Collaborate with stakeholders (Product, Engineering Teams, Peers) to define and set standards for engineering rigor and help cultivate the culture in the team. Proactive attitude and response in identifying and troubleshooting production/development issues. Strong leadership and influence skills, expect to lead and move in an autonomous way, results-driven. What do you need to bring: Proven track record working with real-world projects, and a solid understanding of system design/architecture. Strong knowledge and experience in designing and implementing API, REST, event-driven patterns, and distributed/scalable architectures. Proficiency with backend development in Java, solid knowledge of OOP/OOD, and design patterns. Proficiency in database technologies such as MySQL, Cassandra, Elasticsearch Proficiency in DevOps concepts and using Docker, Jenkins, Git, etc. We know the confidence gap and imposter syndrome can get in the way of meeting spectacular candidates. Please don‚Äôt hesitate to apply. Our Benefits: At PayPal, we‚Äôre committed to building an equitable and inclusive global economy. And we can‚Äôt do this without our most important asset‚Äîyou. That‚Äôs why we offer benefits to help you thrive in every stage of life. We champion your financial, physical, and mental health by offering valuable benefits and resources to help you care for the whole you. We have great benefits including a flexible work environment, employee shares options, health and life insurance and more. To learn more about our benefits please visit https://www.paypalbenefits.com Who We Are: To learn more about our culture and community visit https://about.pypl.com/who-we-are/default.aspx PayPal has remained at the forefront of the digital payment revolution for more than 20 years. By leveraging technology to make financial services and commerce more convenient, affordable, and secure, the PayPal platform is empowering more than 400 million consumers and merchants in more than 200 markets to join and thrive in the global economy. For more information, visit paypal.com. PayPal provides equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, PayPal will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. If you are unable to submit an application because of incompatible assistive technology or a disability, please contact us at paypalglobaltalentacquisition@paypal.com. As part of PayPal‚Äôs commitment to employees‚Äô health and safety, we have established in-office Covid-19 protocols and requirements, based on expert guidance. Depending on location, this might include a Covid-19 vaccination requirement for any employee whose role requires them to work onsite. Employees may request reasonable accommodation based on a medical condition or religious belief that prevents them from being vaccinated. REQ ID R0102866

Title: IBM Integration Bus Specialist - Remote - Latin America
Descripcion: FullStack is the fastest-growing software consultancy in the Americas. We help organizations like Uber, GoDaddy, MGM, Siemens, Stanford University, and the State of California, build distributed software development teams, and deliver transformational digital solutions. As an employee-first company, we focus on hiring the most talented software designers and developers in the western hemisphere, by creating a positive, respectful, and supportive work environment where they can achieve their greatest potential. We‚Äôre most proud of: Offering life-changing career opportunities to talented software professionals across the Americas. Building highly-skilled software development teams for hundreds of the world‚Äôs greatest companies. Having delivered hundreds of successful custom software solutions, which have positively impacted the lives and careers of millions of users. Our 4.5-star rating on GlassDoor. Our client Net Promoter Score of 68, twice the industry average. The Position: We're looking to hire an IBM Integration Bus Specialist to join our team. You'll work with our incredible clients in one of two ways: Team Augmentation: You will integrate yourself directly into our client's team and work alongside their existing designers and engineers on a daily basis. Design & Build: You will work on a FullStack Labs product team to build and deliver a product to our clients. What We're Looking For: 5+ years of professional software development experience. Meaningful experience with the IBM WebSphere, MQ stack, and ESQL. Experience working on Agile / Scrum teams. Proficiency in the Microsoft stack: C#, ASP.Net, and Internet Information Services (IIS). Knowledge of message queue software such as IBM MQ, RabbitMQ, or Amazon SQS. The ability to write SQL queries and produce useful metrics from relational databases. Experience working on support, maintenance, and modernization of complex distributed systems, built around the .Net framework and IBM WebSphere platform. A four-year college degree is required. Advanced English is required. Ability to take extreme ownership over your work. Every day is a challenge to ensure you are performing to the expectations you and your team have agreed upon. Ability to identify with the goals of FullStack's clients, and dedicate yourself to delivering on the commitments you and your team make to them. An understanding of best practices and a commitment to following them. Ability to work through new and difficult issues and contribute to libraries as needed. A positive mindset and a can-do attitude. Forensic attention to detail. Ability to consistently work 40 hours per week. Our Benefits: Competitive pay in your local currency. 100% remote work. The ability to work with leading startups and Fortune 500 companies. English Classes. Virtual company events each month. Ample opportunity for career advancement. Continuing education opportunities. FullStack is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, or Veteran status. Title: Senior SysOps Engineer - Guatemala Remote
Descripcion: IDT is looking for a Systems / SysOps Engineer to join us remotely from Latam. The ideal candidate will have a passion for managing and maintaining the infrastructure that powers a wide range of applications and services. The Systems / SysOps Engineer will be responsible for ensuring the reliability, availability, and performance of the systems and services that our organization depends on. IDT(www.idt.net) is a US communications and financial services company founded in 1990 and headquartered in New Jersey. Today it is an industry leader in prepaid communication and payment services and one of the world‚Äôs largest international voice carriers. We are listed on the NYSE, employ over 1500 people across 20+ countries, and have revenues in excess of $1.5 billion. Responsibilites: Deploy, configure, and maintain the infrastructure, including servers, storage systems, virtual machines & infrastructure in AWS Implement and maintain automation tools and processes for deploying and managing infrastructure Monitor and maintain the systems and services to ensure optimal performance, uptime, and security Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to the infrastructure Collaborate with development teams to ensure the applications are deployed and running efficiently Participate in design and architecture discussions to ensure the infrastructure is scalable, secure, and resilient Implement and maintain disaster recovery and business continuity plans Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices related to the infrastructure and operations Requirements: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or equivalent Minimum 5 years of experience in SysOps or SysAdmin role Strong problem-solving and analytical skills Excellent communication and collaboration skills Experience with one or more of the following areas : Linux, Windows, VMWare, Storage platforms preferably NetApp & Pure Strong understanding of networking concepts, protocols such as dns & smtp, and security Experience with configuration management tools such as Ansible, Chef Experience with scripting languages such as Python, Bash, or PowerShell Nice to have: Experience with cloud based infrastructure, AWS in particular Terraform, Cloudformation Familiarity with containerization technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes Veritas Netbackup Experience with monitoring and logging tools such as Nagios, Zabbix, or Prometheus Please attach CV in English. The interview process will be conducted in English. ONLY accepting applicants from LATAM.

Title: Digital Solutions | Software Development Engineer in Test

Candidates should have experience in Jest, AWS Lambda, TypeScript, Javascript, and backend technologies like NodeJS.   Familiarity with CI/CD tools like AWS Cloud Development Kit or AWS Cloud Formation.   Familiarity with No-SQL databases like DynamoDB and System Integration Patterns (PubSub).   Experience using Agile/Scrum software development methodologies using tools such as Jira,   Confluence.   Experience with GIT or similar source control tools.   Experience in working in an Offshore/Onsite model.   Experience in designing test plans and test cases according to requirements.   Experience writing functional test automation scripts for Web services (REST, knowledge in protocol buffers is a nice to have.).   Good communication skills.   Proven experience in building/maintaining an automation framework. Extra bonus based on performance.   Wellness program: Free Monthly Psychologist and nutritionist  Responsibilities:  Implements test automation for regression and progression scenarios that allow for a repeatable an reliable testing framework.   Identifies and documents defects in all environments, and drives them to resolution.   Reviews test automation code written by other team members.   Follows the team‚Äôs best practices and coding standards.   Performs on-demand and ad hoc manual/automated testing as needed.   Requests and prepares test data for all environments to support the implementation of test scenarios.   Validates Production deployment changes with automation scripts and reports on issues found.   Reports out on automated test results on a daily basis.   Interfaces with the business team to ensure that test scenarios are appropriate and test coverage is complete. Title: Mobile Developer

Title: Digital Solutions | DevOps Engineer
Descripcion: Be a part of a transformational journey with innovative and leading edge technologies. Join our team With the convergence of innovative home and mobile networking technologies, including fibre and 5G, smart home solutions, mobile devices, automation, cloud computing, and over-the-top capabilities, our customers‚Äô homes look very different in today‚Äôs digital world. Every day, TELUS‚Äô engineering and development teams are envisioning what the future holds and building the technologies to simplify our customers‚Äô lives, provide services at the touch of a button, and create immersive entertainment experiences. As a DevOps of our Video and Digital Home team, you will be at the helm of supporting a plethora of home and TV/media platforms and features using Agile development processes. This team is a part of our Future Friendly Home Services DevOps team, which is responsible for the end-to-end technology development and operations of TELUS‚Äô Optik TV services, video and over-the-top services, broadband network capabilities, smart home solutions, and software-defined wide area network (SD-WAN) solutions. This is an exciting time to be a part of our mission to drive better outcomes through state-of-the- art software platforms. The possibilities are endless and we‚Äôre looking for a software enthusiast and self-starter who is filled with ideas as well as the delivery-focused mindset to execute them! Our success is based as much on your dedication and hard work as it is on the innovative television, internet, voice, data and wireless products and solutions we offer. Here‚Äôs the impact you‚Äôll make and what we‚Äôll accomplish together You will help define the architecture for our new Future Friendly Home initiatives, integrating newly developed software with components from leading vendors into a complex cloud-first pattern, in order to deliver to our customers the best possible experience. Here's how:  You will support a video platform/microservices deployed on OCP and GKE clusters and using Galera DB, Cassandra and Elastic Search   You will troubleshoot the Platform microservices using Splunk, Dynatrace or other monitoring tools   You will work cross-functionally to define SLIs, SLOs, SLAs and setup the proper monitoring and alerting to minimize downtime   You will deploy new microservices into the platform to offer new features to our customers   Operational processes and procedures are part of your DNA   Work with cloud-native technologies, combining the modern technologies, practices, and products into a cohesive platform to enable world-leading software development.   You will provide an indication of the effort needed to implement the necessary solutions based on your proactive operational observations.   You will manage on-call schedules and escalation processes  You're the missing piece of the puzzle with these skills:  Kubernetes Container platforms (GKE, EKS, OpenShift)   Infrastructure-as-Code (Terraform)   Galera, Cassandra, Elastic search, MySQL   Load Balancers, Firewalls, Networking   Linux   ActiveMQ   Continuous Integration/Delivery (GitHub Actions, GCP Cloud Build, Spinnaker, Jenkins)  Required Skills & Abilities:  You have 5+ experience as SRE / DevOps Support   You have worked in environments where you were responsible for understanding and ensuring the reliable operation of deployments from end-to-end (front-end to database as well as data ingestion pipelines)   Worked with monitoring tools and understand best practices for alerting   A strong understanding and previous experience with cloud infrastructure such as GCP or other clouds etc   Understanding of SSH, VPN, TCP/IP, DNS, HTTP(S), network routing and subnets   Experience with Configuration Management and Infrastructure as Code - Terraform, Ansible   Good Splunk, Dynatrace or similar tools used to monitor and troubleshoot.   You have good operational knowledge on Kubernetes, MySQL (Galera or MariaDB clusters), Elastic Search and Cassandra   High degree of curiosity and ownership  Great-to-haves  Cloud architectures   Front-end & Mobile application development  Equal Opportunity Employer: At TELUS International, we are proud to be an equal-opportunity employer and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace. All aspects of employment, including the decision to hire and promote, are based on applicants‚Äô qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity. Additional Job Description As a DevOps of our Video and Digital Home team, you will be at the helm of supporting a plethora of home and TV/media platforms and features using Agile development processes. This team is a part of our Future Friendly Home Services DevOps team, which is responsible for the end-to-end technology development and operations of TELUS‚Äô Optik TV services, video and over-the-top services, broadband network capabilities, smart home solutions, and software-defined wide area network (SD-WAN) solutions. EEO Statement At TELUS International, we enable customer experience innovation through spirited teamwork, agile thinking, and a caring culture that puts customers first. TELUS International is the global arm of TELUS Corporation, one of the largest telecommunications service providers in Canada. We deliver contact center and business process outsourcing (BPO) solutions to some of the world's largest corporations in the consumer electronics, finance, telecommunications and utilities sectors. With global call center delivery capabilities, our multi-shore, multi-language programs offer safe, secure infrastructure, value-based pricing, skills-based resources and exceptional customer service - all backed by TELUS, our multi-billion dollar telecommunications parent. Equal Opportunity Employer At TELUS International, we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace. All aspects of employment, including the decision to hire and promote, are based on applicants‚Äô qualifications, merits, competence and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.
